description: Web dashboard loads successfully on localhost:3000
steps: Step 1: Start development server
Step 2: Navigate to http://localhost:3000
Step 3: Verify page loads without errors
Step 4: Check browser console for no critical errors

description: Database connection initializes correctly with Prisma and SQLite
steps: Step 1: Check Prisma schema exists
Step 2: Run prisma migrate dev
Step 3: Verify SQLite database file is created
Step 4: Test database connection with a simple query

description: User can provide a local git repository path for analysis
steps: Step 1: Navigate to repository setup page
Step 2: Enter valid local repository path
Step 3: Click 'Analyze Repository' button
Step 4: Verify repository path is accepted
Step 5: Check loading state appears

description: User can provide a git URL for repository cloning and analysis
steps: Step 1: Navigate to repository setup page
Step 2: Enter valid git URL (e.g., GitHub repository)
Step 3: Click 'Clone & Analyze' button
Step 4: Verify cloning progress is displayed
Step 5: Wait for clone completion

description: Repository analysis engine scans file structure and creates knowledge graph
steps: Step 1: Provide sample repository for analysis
Step 2: Trigger analysis process
Step 3: Monitor analysis progress bar
Step 4: Verify completion notification
Step 5: Check that file structure is extracted
Step 6: Verify knowledge graph is created in database
Step 7: Confirm analysis results are cached

description: TypeScript/JavaScript files are parsed and analyzed correctly
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with TypeScript files
Step 2: Verify imports/exports are detected
Step 3: Check function definitions are extracted
Step 4: Confirm component relationships are identified

description: Python files are parsed and analyzed correctly
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with Python files
Step 2: Verify imports are detected
Step 3: Check function and class definitions are extracted
Step 4: Confirm module structure is mapped

description: Go files are parsed and analyzed correctly
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with Go files
Step 2: Verify package imports are detected
Step 3: Check function definitions are extracted
Step 4: Confirm module dependencies are identified

description: Rust files are parsed and analyzed correctly
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with Rust files
Step 2: Verify crate dependencies are detected
Step 3: Check function and module definitions are extracted
Step 4: Confirm trait implementations are identified

description: Java files are parsed and analyzed correctly
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with Java files
Step 2: Verify package imports are detected
Step 3: Check class and method definitions are extracted
Step 4: Confirm inheritance relationships are identified

description: Monorepo structures are correctly identified and analyzed
steps: Step 1: Provide monorepo with multiple packages
Step 2: Trigger analysis
Step 3: Verify each package is identified separately
Step 4: Check cross-package dependencies are detected
Step 5: Confirm package.json workspaces are recognized

description: File metadata extraction (LOC, complexity, last modified, authors)
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository
Step 2: Select a file from the analyzed codebase
Step 3: Verify LOC (lines of code) is displayed
Step 4: Check complexity score is shown
Step 5: Confirm last modified date is present
Step 6: Verify primary authors are listed

description: Call graphs are built showing function invocation relationships
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with function calls
Step 2: Navigate to call graph view
Step 3: Select a function
Step 4: Verify all functions it calls are shown
Step 5: Verify all functions that call it are shown

description: Dependency trees show module and package relationships
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository
Step 2: Navigate to dependency tree view
Step 3: Verify package.json dependencies are displayed
Step 4: Check internal module dependencies are shown
Step 5: Confirm tree structure is hierarchical and navigable

description: Common frameworks (React, Express, FastAPI) are automatically detected
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository using React
Step 2: Check framework detection results
Step 3: Verify React is identified with version
Step 4: Test with Express backend repository
Step 5: Test with FastAPI Python repository

description: Analysis results are cached for fast subsequent queries
steps: Step 1: Perform initial repository analysis (note duration)
Step 2: Complete analysis
Step 3: Query the same repository again
Step 4: Verify results load from cache (much faster)
Step 5: Check cache invalidation works on repo changes

description: Incremental analysis updates when code changes are detected
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository initially
Step 2: Modify a file in the repository
Step 3: Trigger incremental analysis
Step 4: Verify only changed files are re-analyzed
Step 5: Confirm analysis is faster than full re-scan
Step 6: Check knowledge graph is updated correctly

description: AI chat interface loads and displays correctly
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Chat page
Step 2: Verify chat input field is visible
Step 3: Check send button is present
Step 4: Confirm chat history area is displayed

description: User can ask a question about the codebase and receive an answer
steps: Step 1: Complete repository analysis
Step 2: Navigate to Chat interface
Step 3: Type question: 'Where is authentication handled?'
Step 4: Click send
Step 5: Wait for AI response
Step 6: Verify response includes relevant information
Step 7: Check that file paths are included in answer
Step 8: Verify line numbers are provided
Step 9: Confirm code snippets are shown

description: Chat maintains conversation context across multiple messages
steps: Step 1: Ask initial question about authentication
Step 2: Wait for response
Step 3: Ask follow-up: 'Can you show me how it's used?'
Step 4: Verify AI understands context from previous question
Step 5: Check response builds on previous answer

description: Chat responses include clickable file paths to view code
steps: Step 1: Ask question via chat
Step 2: Receive response with file path
Step 3: Verify file path is displayed as hyperlink
Step 4: Click the file path link
Step 5: Confirm code viewer opens showing the file
Step 6: Verify correct line is highlighted

description: Chat understands query: 'Where is authentication?'
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with authentication code
Step 2: Ask: 'Where is authentication?'
Step 3: Verify response identifies auth files
Step 4: Check accuracy of response

description: Chat understands query: 'How does data flow?'
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with data flow
Step 2: Ask: 'How does data flow from API to frontend?'
Step 3: Verify response traces data flow
Step 4: Check multiple files are referenced

description: Chat understands query: 'What calls this function?'
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository
Step 2: Ask about a specific function
Step 3: Verify response lists all callers
Step 4: Check file paths and line numbers are provided

description: Chat can explain design decisions by analyzing code patterns
steps: Step 1: Ask: 'Why is this pattern used?'
Step 2: Verify AI analyzes code structure
Step 3: Check response explains architectural reasoning
Step 4: Confirm multiple examples are referenced

description: Chat responses include confidence scores
steps: Step 1: Ask a question via chat
Step 2: Receive response
Step 3: Verify confidence score is displayed (e.g., 'Confidence: 85%')
Step 4: Check score reflects answer certainty

description: Chat suggests relevant follow-up questions
steps: Step 1: Ask initial question
Step 2: Receive response
Step 3: Verify 2-3 follow-up questions are suggested
Step 4: Click a suggested question
Step 5: Confirm it's automatically sent and answered

description: Chat history is saved per repository
steps: Step 1: Have conversation with repository A
Step 2: Switch to repository B
Step 3: Have different conversation
Step 4: Switch back to repository A
Step 5: Verify original chat history is restored
Step 6: Check repository B history is separate

description: Chat can compare current codebase to similar open-source projects
steps: Step 1: Ask: 'How does this compare to similar projects?'
Step 2: Verify AI identifies comparable projects
Step 3: Check response highlights differences
Step 4: Confirm architectural comparison is provided

description: Interactive dependency graph diagram renders correctly
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository
Step 2: Navigate to Architecture Diagrams page
Step 3: Select 'Dependency Graph' view
Step 4: Verify graph renders with nodes and edges
Step 5: Check all files are represented as nodes

description: Interactive call graph diagram shows function relationships
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Architecture Diagrams
Step 2: Select 'Call Graph' view
Step 3: Verify functions are displayed as nodes
Step 4: Check call relationships are shown as arrows
Step 5: Confirm graph layout is readable

description: Data flow diagram visualizes information flow through the system
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Architecture Diagrams
Step 2: Select 'Data Flow' view
Step 3: Verify data sources are identified
Step 4: Check transformations are shown
Step 5: Confirm data destinations are displayed

description: Module hierarchy diagram shows component organization
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Architecture Diagrams
Step 2: Select 'Module Hierarchy' view
Step 3: Verify top-level modules are shown
Step 4: Check sub-modules are nested correctly
Step 5: Confirm hierarchy is intuitive

description: Diagram nodes are clickable to view associated code
steps: Step 1: Open dependency graph
Step 2: Click a file node
Step 3: Verify code viewer modal opens
Step 4: Check correct file content is displayed
Step 5: Confirm syntax highlighting is applied

description: Diagram supports zoom and pan interactions
steps: Step 1: Open architecture diagram
Step 2: Use mouse wheel to zoom in
Step 3: Verify graph zooms smoothly
Step 4: Zoom out
Step 5: Click and drag to pan
Step 6: Confirm panning works smoothly

description: Diagram can be filtered by language
steps: Step 1: Open diagram with multiple languages
Step 2: Apply 'TypeScript only' filter
Step 3: Verify only TypeScript files are shown
Step 4: Clear filter
Step 5: Apply 'Python only' filter
Step 6: Verify filtering works correctly

description: Diagram can be filtered by date range (file age)
steps: Step 1: Open diagram
Step 2: Apply date filter 'Last 30 days'
Step 3: Verify only recently modified files shown
Step 4: Try 'Older than 6 months' filter
Step 5: Confirm filtering accuracy

description: Diagram can be filtered by complexity
steps: Step 1: Open diagram
Step 2: Apply 'High complexity only' filter
Step 3: Verify only complex files are shown
Step 4: Check complexity threshold is appropriate

description: Diagram nodes are color-coded by language
steps: Step 1: Open diagram with multiple languages
Step 2: Verify TypeScript nodes have distinct color
Step 3: Check Python nodes have different color
Step 4: Confirm legend shows color mapping

description: Diagram nodes can be color-coded by file age
steps: Step 1: Open diagram
Step 2: Select 'Color by age' option
Step 3: Verify recent files are one color
Step 4: Check old files are different color
Step 5: Confirm gradient or discrete coloring is clear

description: Diagram nodes can be color-coded by complexity
steps: Step 1: Open diagram
Step 2: Select 'Color by complexity' option
Step 3: Verify high complexity files are highlighted
Step 4: Check color scale is intuitive

description: Diagram nodes can be color-coded by team ownership
steps: Step 1: Open diagram
Step 2: Select 'Color by team' option
Step 3: Verify different teams have distinct colors
Step 4: Check ownership is derived from git history

description: Diagrams can be exported as SVG
steps: Step 1: Open architecture diagram
Step 2: Click 'Export' button
Step 3: Select 'SVG' format
Step 4: Verify download starts
Step 5: Open downloaded SVG file
Step 6: Confirm diagram is correctly exported

description: Diagrams can be exported as PNG
steps: Step 1: Open architecture diagram
Step 2: Click 'Export' button
Step 3: Select 'PNG' format
Step 4: Verify download starts
Step 5: Open downloaded PNG file
Step 6: Confirm image quality is good

description: Hot paths (frequently changed files) are highlighted in diagrams
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with git history
Step 2: Open dependency graph
Step 3: Enable 'Show hot paths' option
Step 4: Verify frequently changed files are highlighted
Step 5: Check highlighting intensity matches change frequency

description: Clicking a node shows its import/export relationships
steps: Step 1: Open dependency graph
Step 2: Click a file node
Step 3: Verify panel shows 'Imports' section
Step 4: Check all imported files are listed
Step 5: Verify 'Exports' section shows what this file exports
Step 6: Confirm 'Used by' section lists dependent files

description: Circular dependencies are detected and highlighted
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with circular dependencies
Step 2: Open dependency graph
Step 3: Verify circular dependencies are marked (e.g., red highlight)
Step 4: Click warning icon
Step 5: Confirm details about the cycle are shown

description: Architectural smells (code quality issues) are identified in diagrams
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository
Step 2: Open architecture diagram
Step 3: Enable 'Show architectural smells' option
Step 4: Verify issues like God classes are highlighted
Step 5: Check tight coupling is indicated
Step 6: Confirm clicking provides explanation

description: User can select their role (Backend, Frontend, Full-Stack, DevOps)
steps: Step 1: Complete repository analysis
Step 2: Navigate to Learning Path setup
Step 3: Verify role selection options are displayed
Step 4: Select 'Backend Engineer' role
Step 5: Confirm selection is saved

description: Personalized learning path is generated based on role
steps: Step 1: Select 'Backend Engineer' role
Step 2: Trigger learning path generation
Step 3: Verify backend-focused files are prioritized
Step 4: Check API and database files appear early
Step 5: Confirm frontend files are deprioritized or later

description: Learning path suggests optimal reading order for files
steps: Step 1: Generate learning path
Step 2: View suggested order
Step 3: Verify entry points come first
Step 4: Check dependencies come before dependents
Step 5: Confirm order is logical

description: Estimated time to review each file/module is shown
steps: Step 1: Open learning path
Step 2: View file list
Step 3: Verify each file has time estimate (e.g., '15 min')
Step 4: Check estimates correlate with file complexity
Step 5: Confirm total time is displayed

description: User progress through learning path is tracked
steps: Step 1: Start learning path
Step 2: Mark first file as reviewed
Step 3: Verify progress percentage updates
Step 4: Mark several more files as reviewed
Step 5: Confirm progress bar reflects completion

description: Learning path shows interactive checklist with completion percentage
steps: Step 1: Open learning path
Step 2: Verify checklist is displayed
Step 3: Check checkboxes for files
Step 4: Confirm checked items are marked complete
Step 5: Verify completion percentage is accurate

description: Quizzes test understanding of key concepts in the codebase
steps: Step 1: Complete review of a module
Step 2: Trigger quiz for that module
Step 3: Verify multiple choice questions appear
Step 4: Answer questions
Step 5: Submit quiz
Step 6: Check score is calculated
Step 7: Verify correct answers are shown

description: Days to first PR estimation is provided based on codebase size
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository
Step 2: Navigate to learning path dashboard
Step 3: Verify 'Estimated time to first PR' is shown
Step 4: Check estimate is reasonable (e.g., '5-7 days')
Step 5: Confirm it's based on LOC and complexity

description: Learning path adjusts based on user feedback (skip basics)
steps: Step 1: Start learning path
Step 2: Click 'I already know this' on basic modules
Step 3: Verify those modules are marked complete automatically
Step 4: Check advanced modules are prioritized
Step 5: Confirm path is updated dynamically

description: Learning path adjusts based on user feedback (explain more)
steps: Step 1: Start learning path
Step 2: Click 'Need more explanation' on a module
Step 3: Verify additional resources are provided
Step 4: Check related files are suggested
Step 5: Confirm extra context is shown

description: User can resume learning path from where they left off
steps: Step 1: Start learning path and complete some items
Step 2: Close browser/log out
Step 3: Return later and log in
Step 4: Navigate to learning path
Step 5: Verify progress is preserved
Step 6: Confirm next uncompleted item is highlighted

description: Code viewer displays syntax-highlighted code
steps: Step 1: Navigate to any file in the web viewer
Step 2: Verify syntax highlighting is applied
Step 3: Check keywords are colored differently
Step 4: Confirm strings, comments, functions are distinct
Step 5: Verify line numbers are shown

description: Hover over function in code viewer shows inline tooltip
steps: Step 1: Open code viewer
Step 2: Hover mouse over a function name
Step 3: Verify tooltip appears
Step 4: Check tooltip shows function purpose
Step 5: Verify parameters are described
Step 6: Confirm return value is shown

description: Tooltip shows callers of hovered function
steps: Step 1: Hover over function in code viewer
Step 2: View tooltip
Step 3: Verify 'Called by' section exists
Step 4: Check list of caller functions is shown
Step 5: Confirm file paths are included

description: Tooltip shows 'connects to' relationship hints
steps: Step 1: Hover over a component/module
Step 2: View tooltip
Step 3: Verify 'Connects to' section is present
Step 4: Check related components are listed
Step 5: Confirm relationships are accurate

description: Annotations highlight common gotchas and edge cases
steps: Step 1: View code with known edge cases
Step 2: Verify warning annotations appear inline
Step 3: Click or hover over annotation
Step 4: Check explanation of gotcha is shown
Step 5: Confirm examples are provided

description: Team members can add custom annotations to code
steps: Step 1: Open code viewer
Step 2: Click 'Add annotation' button on a line
Step 3: Enter annotation text
Step 4: Save annotation
Step 5: Verify annotation appears on that line
Step 6: Confirm author name is shown

description: Annotations are versioned and tied to specific code versions
steps: Step 1: Add annotation to code at version A
Step 2: Code is modified (version B)
Step 3: View code at version A
Step 4: Verify annotation is still visible
Step 5: View code at version B
Step 6: Check annotation status (moved/outdated/preserved)

description: Annotation packs can be exported for team sharing
steps: Step 1: Create several annotations
Step 2: Navigate to annotations management
Step 3: Click 'Export annotations' button
Step 4: Verify JSON/file is downloaded
Step 5: Check all annotations are in export

description: Annotation packs can be imported
steps: Step 1: Have exported annotation file
Step 2: Navigate to annotations management
Step 3: Click 'Import annotations' button
Step 4: Select file to import
Step 5: Verify annotations are loaded
Step 6: Check they appear in code viewer

description: Runnable examples are auto-generated for major features
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with identifiable features
Step 2: Navigate to Examples section
Step 3: Verify list of generated examples
Step 4: Check examples cover key functionality
Step 5: Confirm examples are minimal and focused

description: Examples include auto-generated mock data
steps: Step 1: Open a generated example
Step 2: Verify mock data is provided
Step 3: Check data structure matches actual code
Step 4: Confirm data is realistic

description: Try it button runs example code in sandbox
steps: Step 1: Open an example
Step 2: Click 'Try it' button
Step 3: Verify sandbox environment loads
Step 4: Check code executes
Step 5: Confirm output is displayed
Step 6: Verify execution is isolated (doesn't affect real code)

description: Examples show input and output for each scenario
steps: Step 1: Open example
Step 2: Verify 'Input' section shows sample data
Step 3: Check 'Output' section shows expected result
Step 4: Confirm examples are clear

description: Examples include step-by-step explanations
steps: Step 1: Open example
Step 2: Verify explanation text is present
Step 3: Check explanation walks through code logic
Step 4: Confirm key concepts are highlighted

description: Integration test templates are generated from examples
steps: Step 1: View a runnable example
Step 2: Click 'Generate test template' button
Step 3: Verify test code is generated
Step 4: Check test structure is valid
Step 5: Confirm assertions are included

description: Examples work for API endpoints
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with REST API
Step 2: Navigate to Examples
Step 3: Find API endpoint example
Step 4: Verify request format is shown
Step 5: Check response format is displayed
Step 6: Confirm 'Try it' sends actual request

description: Examples work for UI components
steps: Step 1: Analyze React/UI codebase
Step 2: Navigate to Examples
Step 3: Find component example
Step 4: Verify component renders in preview
Step 5: Check props are documented

description: Examples work for utility functions
steps: Step 1: Find utility function examples
Step 2: Verify function signature is shown
Step 3: Check multiple usage examples exist
Step 4: Confirm edge cases are demonstrated

description: Git history is analyzed to identify top contributors per module
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with git history
Step 2: Navigate to a file or module
Step 3: View 'Contributors' section
Step 4: Verify top contributors are listed
Step 5: Check commit counts are shown
Step 6: Confirm most recent contributor is highlighted

description: Subject matter experts are identified per code area
steps: Step 1: View a module or feature
Step 2: Check 'Expert' or 'Ask' section
Step 3: Verify SME name is shown
Step 4: Check contact information if available
Step 5: Confirm expertise is based on contribution history

description: Common patterns are extracted from PR review comments
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with PR history
Step 2: Navigate to 'Team Knowledge' section
Step 3: View 'Review Patterns' subsection
Step 4: Verify common feedback is listed (e.g., 'Always add tests')
Step 5: Check patterns are categorized
Step 6: Confirm examples from actual PRs are linked

description: Common mistakes identified from PR feedback are documented
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Team Knowledge
Step 2: View 'Common Mistakes' section
Step 3: Verify mistakes are listed
Step 4: Check each has description and fix
Step 5: Confirm related code areas are linked

description: Timeline of major architectural changes is visualized
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Architecture History
Step 2: Verify timeline visualization exists
Step 3: Check major changes are marked on timeline
Step 4: Click a change event
Step 5: Confirm details and commits are shown

description: Why was this decision made? answered from commit messages
steps: Step 1: View a file or module
Step 2: Click 'Why this approach?' button
Step 3: Verify AI searches relevant commits
Step 4: Check commit messages are analyzed
Step 5: Confirm explanation is synthesized
Step 6: Verify original commits are linked

description: Deprecated patterns still in use are identified
steps: Step 1: Analyze codebase with deprecated code
Step 2: Navigate to 'Code Health' section
Step 3: View 'Deprecated Patterns' list
Step 4: Verify deprecated patterns are detected
Step 5: Check affected files are listed
Step 6: Confirm migration suggestions are provided

description: Code ownership heatmap shows who owns what
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Team view
Step 2: View ownership heatmap
Step 3: Verify files are colored by primary owner
Step 4: Check legend shows team member colors
Step 5: Confirm clicking shows owner details

description: People are connected to their code areas of expertise
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Team Members list
Step 2: Click a team member
Step 3: Verify their code areas are displayed
Step 4: Check contribution statistics are shown
Step 5: Confirm expertise tags are assigned

description: CLI tool installs globally via npm
steps: Step 1: Run npm install -g codecompass-cli
Step 2: Verify installation succeeds
Step 3: Run codecompass --version
Step 4: Check version is displayed

description: CLI can analyze a local repository
steps: Step 1: Run codecompass analyze /path/to/repo
Step 2: Verify analysis progress is shown
Step 3: Check colored output indicates progress
Step 4: Confirm completion message appears
Step 5: Verify analysis results are cached

description: CLI can answer quick queries about the codebase
steps: Step 1: Run codecompass ask 'where is authentication?'
Step 2: Verify CLI connects to analysis backend
Step 3: Check answer is displayed in terminal
Step 4: Confirm file paths are shown
Step 5: Verify response time is under 3 seconds

description: CLI can generate onboarding reports
steps: Step 1: Run codecompass report --format markdown
Step 2: Verify report generation progress
Step 3: Check report file is created
Step 4: Open report
Step 5: Confirm report includes architecture, stats, learning path

description: CLI displays colorful, informative output with Chalk
steps: Step 1: Run any CLI command
Step 2: Verify output uses colors
Step 3: Check success messages are green
Step 4: Verify errors are red
Step 5: Confirm warnings are yellow

description: CLI shows progress bars for long operations
steps: Step 1: Start repository analysis via CLI
Step 2: Verify progress bar appears
Step 3: Check progress bar updates smoothly
Step 4: Confirm percentage is shown
Step 5: Verify bar completes at 100%

description: CLI displays data in formatted tables
steps: Step 1: Run command that returns structured data
Step 2: Verify table format is used
Step 3: Check columns are aligned
Step 4: Confirm headers are clear

description: CLI has interactive mode with prompts
steps: Step 1: Run codecompass interactive
Step 2: Verify interactive prompt appears
Step 3: Select options using arrow keys
Step 4: Confirm selections are processed
Step 5: Check commands execute based on selections

description: CLI provides help text with examples
steps: Step 1: Run codecompass --help
Step 2: Verify help text is displayed
Step 3: Check all commands are documented
Step 4: Confirm examples are provided
Step 5: Verify options are explained

description: CLI supports command abbreviations
steps: Step 1: Try abbreviated command (e.g., 'cc a' for analyze)
Step 2: Verify command is recognized
Step 3: Check execution is same as full command
Step 4: Test multiple abbreviations

description: VS Code extension installs from VSIX file
steps: Step 1: Build extension VSIX
Step 2: Open VS Code
Step 3: Install from VSIX
Step 4: Verify extension appears in extensions list
Step 5: Check extension is enabled

description: VS Code extension adds sidebar icon to activity bar
steps: Step 1: Install extension
Step 2: Check VS Code activity bar
Step 3: Verify CodeCompass icon is present
Step 4: Click icon
Step 5: Confirm sidebar panel opens

description: VS Code extension shows hover tooltips on function hover
steps: Step 1: Open a code file in VS Code
Step 2: Hover over a function
Step 3: Verify CodeCompass tooltip appears
Step 4: Check tooltip shows function info
Step 5: Confirm it doesn't interfere with VS Code's native tooltip

description: VS Code extension displays inline annotations in editor
steps: Step 1: Open file with annotations
Step 2: Verify inline decorations appear
Step 3: Check annotations are visible but non-intrusive
Step 4: Click annotation
Step 5: Confirm full text is shown

description: VS Code extension sidebar shows repository overview
steps: Step 1: Open CodeCompass sidebar
Step 2: Verify repository name is displayed
Step 3: Check key statistics are shown (LOC, files, etc.)
Step 4: Confirm quick links are available

description: VS Code extension settings integrate with VS Code preferences
steps: Step 1: Open VS Code settings
Step 2: Search for CodeCompass
Step 3: Verify extension settings appear
Step 4: Modify a setting
Step 5: Confirm change is applied in extension

description: All interfaces (web, CLI, VS Code) share the same backend analysis
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository via web dashboard
Step 2: Query via CLI
Step 3: Verify CLI uses same cached analysis
Step 4: Open VS Code extension
Step 5: Confirm VS Code also uses same data

description: Settings sync across all interfaces
steps: Step 1: Change setting in web dashboard
Step 2: Open CLI
Step 3: Verify setting is reflected
Step 4: Open VS Code extension
Step 5: Confirm setting is synced there too

description: Personal dashboard shows onboarding completion percentage
steps: Step 1: Log in to web dashboard
Step 2: Navigate to personal dashboard
Step 3: Verify completion percentage is displayed
Step 4: Check it reflects learning path progress
Step 5: Confirm it updates as progress is made

description: Dashboard tracks time spent in each module
steps: Step 1: Open a module in learning path
Step 2: Spend time reviewing it
Step 3: Return to dashboard
Step 4: Verify time spent is recorded
Step 5: Check time is accurate

description: Dashboard displays quiz scores and understanding metrics
steps: Step 1: Complete some quizzes
Step 2: Navigate to dashboard
Step 3: Verify quiz scores are shown
Step 4: Check understanding metrics are calculated
Step 5: Confirm weak areas are identified

description: Dashboard compares user progress to team average
steps: Step 1: Multiple users onboard to same repo
Step 2: View personal dashboard
Step 3: Verify team average is shown
Step 4: Check comparison is clear (faster/slower)
Step 5: Confirm comparison is helpful

description: Dashboard identifies knowledge gaps
steps: Step 1: Complete partial onboarding
Step 2: View dashboard
Step 3: Check 'Knowledge Gaps' section
Step 4: Verify uncovered areas are listed
Step 5: Confirm suggestions for improvement are given

description: Manager view shows team onboarding status
steps: Step 1: Log in as manager
Step 2: Navigate to team dashboard
Step 3: Verify all team members are listed
Step 4: Check each member's progress is shown
Step 5: Confirm sorting and filtering options exist

description: Automated check-ins ask about progress
steps: Step 1: Use system for several days
Step 2: Receive automated check-in notification
Step 3: Verify check-in asks relevant questions
Step 4: Respond to check-in
Step 5: Confirm response is recorded

description: Git webhook integration can be configured
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings > Integrations
Step 2: Find Git Webhooks section
Step 3: Enter webhook URL
Step 4: Save configuration
Step 5: Verify test webhook succeeds

description: Notifications sent when learned areas change significantly
steps: Step 1: Complete learning for a module
Step 2: Simulate significant change to that module
Step 3: Trigger webhook or polling
Step 4: Verify notification is generated
Step 5: Check notification describes the change

description: What's new since you joined summaries are generated
steps: Step 1: Record join date
Step 2: Wait for commits after join date (or simulate)
Step 3: Navigate to 'What's New' section
Step 4: Verify summary of changes since join
Step 5: Check changes are categorized and prioritized

description: Breaking changes in focus areas are highlighted
steps: Step 1: Mark certain modules as focus areas
Step 2: Simulate breaking changes in those areas
Step 3: Check notifications
Step 4: Verify breaking changes are prominently highlighted
Step 5: Confirm migration guides are suggested

description: System suggests when to re-review modules
steps: Step 1: Complete review of a module
Step 2: Module changes significantly over time
Step 3: Check dashboard
Step 4: Verify suggestion to re-review appears
Step 5: Confirm clicking takes to updated content

description: Onboarding content stays fresh automatically via change detection
steps: Step 1: Set up change detection
Step 2: Code evolves over time
Step 3: Check learning paths
Step 4: Verify paths are updated to reflect changes
Step 5: Confirm outdated content is flagged

description: Repository analysis completes in under 2 minutes for 100K LOC
steps: Step 1: Prepare test repository with ~100K LOC
Step 2: Start analysis timer
Step 3: Trigger repository analysis
Step 4: Wait for completion
Step 5: Stop timer
Step 6: Verify time is under 2 minutes

description: Chat responses return in under 3 seconds
steps: Step 1: Ask a chat question
Step 2: Start response timer
Step 3: Wait for response
Step 4: Stop timer
Step 5: Verify time is under 3 seconds

description: Diagrams render smoothly at 60fps with up to 1000 nodes
steps: Step 1: Create test case with 1000-node graph
Step 2: Render diagram
Step 3: Measure frame rate during pan/zoom
Step 4: Verify FPS is consistently near 60
Step 5: Check for lag or stuttering

description: CLI queries return in under 1 second for cached data
steps: Step 1: Run query once to populate cache
Step 2: Run same query again
Step 3: Start timer
Step 4: Wait for response
Step 5: Verify response time under 1 second

description: VS Code extension causes no noticeable editor lag
steps: Step 1: Install extension in large codebase
Step 2: Type in editor
Step 3: Verify typing is responsive
Step 4: Scroll through file
Step 5: Confirm no stuttering or delays

description: User authentication system allows login
steps: Step 1: Navigate to login page
Step 2: Enter credentials
Step 3: Click login button
Step 4: Verify successful login
Step 5: Check redirect to dashboard

description: User authentication system allows registration
steps: Step 1: Navigate to registration page
Step 2: Enter new user details
Step 3: Submit registration
Step 4: Verify account creation
Step 5: Check email verification if required

description: API keys are stored securely in environment variables
steps: Step 1: Check for .env.example file
Step 2: Verify API key variables are defined
Step 3: Confirm .env is in .gitignore
Step 4: Test that app reads from .env correctly

description: Rate limiting prevents excessive AI queries
steps: Step 1: Send multiple rapid AI queries
Step 2: Verify rate limit is enforced after threshold
Step 3: Check error message is user-friendly
Step 4: Wait for rate limit reset
Step 5: Confirm queries work again

description: All user inputs are sanitized to prevent injection attacks
steps: Step 1: Try entering malicious input in chat
Step 2: Verify input is sanitized
Step 3: Check no code execution occurs
Step 4: Test with SQL injection patterns
Step 5: Confirm all inputs are safe

description: Error handling shows user-friendly messages
steps: Step 1: Trigger various error conditions
Step 2: Verify error messages are clear
Step 3: Check messages suggest solutions
Step 4: Confirm no stack traces shown to users
Step 5: Verify errors are logged for debugging

description: Loading states appear during data fetching
steps: Step 1: Trigger data fetch operation
Step 2: Verify loading indicator appears immediately
Step 3: Check loading state is visible until complete
Step 4: Confirm smooth transition to loaded state

description: Progress indicators shown for long operations
steps: Step 1: Start repository analysis
Step 2: Verify progress indicator appears
Step 3: Check progress updates incrementally
Step 4: Confirm completion at 100%

description: Empty states provide helpful guidance
steps: Step 1: Navigate to section with no data
Step 2: Verify empty state message appears
Step 3: Check guidance on what to do next
Step 4: Confirm call-to-action button is present

description: Skeleton loaders display during initial data loads
steps: Step 1: Load page that fetches data
Step 2: Verify skeleton loader appears
Step 3: Check skeleton matches final content structure
Step 4: Confirm smooth transition to real content

description: Web dashboard has clean, modern design
steps: Step 1: Navigate to web dashboard
Step 2: Take screenshot
Step 3: Verify design is clean and uncluttered
Step 4: Check modern UI patterns are used
Step 5: Confirm alignment with GitHub/Linear aesthetics

description: Sidebar navigation is present with correct sections
steps: Step 1: Open web dashboard
Step 2: Verify sidebar is visible
Step 3: Check Dashboard link is present
Step 4: Verify Chat, Diagrams, Learning Path, Settings links
Step 5: Confirm active section is highlighted

description: Main content area includes breadcrumbs for navigation
steps: Step 1: Navigate deep into site hierarchy
Step 2: Verify breadcrumbs are displayed
Step 3: Check breadcrumbs show full path
Step 4: Click breadcrumb link
Step 5: Confirm navigation works

description: Code snippets displayed in cards with syntax highlighting
steps: Step 1: View page with code snippets
Step 2: Verify snippets are in card containers
Step 3: Check syntax highlighting is applied
Step 4: Confirm language badge is shown
Step 5: Verify copy button is present

description: Toast notifications appear for user actions
steps: Step 1: Perform action (e.g., save settings)
Step 2: Verify toast notification appears
Step 3: Check message is clear
Step 4: Confirm toast auto-dismisses
Step 5: Verify positioning is non-intrusive

description: Web dashboard is mobile-responsive
steps: Step 1: Open dashboard in mobile viewport
Step 2: Verify layout adapts to small screen
Step 3: Check navigation is accessible (hamburger menu)
Step 4: Test interactions work on mobile
Step 5: Confirm no horizontal scrolling

description: Dark mode is available and works correctly
steps: Step 1: Find dark mode toggle
Step 2: Switch to dark mode
Step 3: Verify colors change appropriately
Step 4: Check contrast is maintained
Step 5: Confirm all components support dark mode

description: Light mode has proper contrast and readability
steps: Step 1: Switch to light mode
Step 2: Take screenshot
Step 3: Verify text is readable
Step 4: Check WCAG contrast requirements are met
Step 5: Confirm no elements are washed out

description: Consistent typography throughout the application
steps: Step 1: Navigate through multiple pages
Step 2: Verify font family is consistent
Step 3: Check heading hierarchy is clear
Step 4: Confirm font sizes are appropriate
Step 5: Verify line height and spacing are comfortable

description: Color scheme is consistent and professional
steps: Step 1: View multiple pages
Step 2: Verify primary colors are used consistently
Step 3: Check accent colors are appropriate
Step 4: Confirm color palette is limited and coherent
Step 5: Verify colors have semantic meaning

description: Interactive elements have clear hover and focus states
steps: Step 1: Hover over buttons
Step 2: Verify hover state is visible
Step 3: Tab through interactive elements
Step 4: Check focus indicators are clear
Step 5: Confirm states are consistent

description: Animations are smooth and purposeful using Framer Motion
steps: Step 1: Navigate between pages
Step 2: Verify page transitions are animated
Step 3: Check animations are smooth (not jarring)
Step 4: Confirm animations have purpose
Step 5: Verify performance is not impacted

description: Anthropic Claude API integration works for code analysis
steps: Step 1: Configure API key
Step 2: Trigger analysis requiring AI
Step 3: Verify API request is sent
Step 4: Check response is received
Step 5: Confirm Claude Sonnet 4 is used

description: RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) provides accurate answers
steps: Step 1: Ask question requiring code context
Step 2: Verify relevant code is retrieved
Step 3: Check AI answer incorporates retrieved context
Step 4: Confirm answer accuracy
Step 5: Verify source citations are included

description: Vector database stores code embeddings for semantic search
steps: Step 1: Complete repository analysis
Step 2: Verify embeddings are generated
Step 3: Check embeddings are stored in vector DB
Step 4: Perform semantic search query
Step 5: Confirm relevant results are returned

description: Tree-sitter correctly parses multiple programming languages
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with mixed languages
Step 2: Verify tree-sitter is used for parsing
Step 3: Check TypeScript parsing works
Step 4: Verify Python parsing works
Step 5: Test Go, Rust, Java parsing

description: Simple-git library integrates for repository operations
steps: Step 1: Trigger git operation (clone, log, etc.)
Step 2: Verify simple-git is used
Step 3: Check operation completes successfully
Step 4: Confirm git data is extracted correctly

description: Prisma ORM connects to SQLite database
steps: Step 1: Initialize Prisma
Step 2: Verify Prisma schema is valid
Step 3: Run migration
Step 4: Check SQLite file is created
Step 5: Test CRUD operations via Prisma

description: Database schema includes models for repos, files, users, annotations
steps: Step 1: Review Prisma schema file
Step 2: Verify Repository model exists
Step 3: Check File model is defined
Step 4: Confirm User model is present
Step 5: Verify Annotation model exists
Step 6: Check relationships between models

description: Next.js App Router is used for routing
steps: Step 1: Check project uses Next.js 14+
Step 2: Verify app directory exists
Step 3: Check page routes are in app directory
Step 4: Confirm routing works as expected

description: Next.js API routes handle backend logic
steps: Step 1: Locate API routes in app/api
Step 2: Verify API endpoints exist
Step 3: Test API call from frontend
Step 4: Check response is correct

description: Tailwind CSS is configured and working
steps: Step 1: Check tailwind.config file exists
Step 2: Verify Tailwind classes are used in components
Step 3: Inspect rendered HTML for Tailwind classes
Step 4: Confirm styling is applied correctly

description: Shadcn/ui components are installed and used
steps: Step 1: Check components directory for shadcn components
Step 2: Verify at least 5 shadcn components are used
Step 3: Check components render correctly
Step 4: Confirm styling matches shadcn design

description: D3.js renders interactive graphs
steps: Step 1: Navigate to diagram with D3
Step 2: Verify D3 is loaded
Step 3: Check graph renders
Step 4: Test interactivity (zoom, pan)
Step 5: Confirm smooth performance

description: Zustand manages UI state correctly
steps: Step 1: Check Zustand store is defined
Step 2: Modify UI state via actions
Step 3: Verify UI updates reflect state changes
Step 4: Confirm state persists across component re-renders

description: React Query manages server state and caching
steps: Step 1: Check React Query is configured
Step 2: Make API request
Step 3: Verify data is cached
Step 4: Make same request again
Step 5: Confirm cached data is used

description: TypeScript strict mode is enabled throughout
steps: Step 1: Check tsconfig.json
Step 2: Verify strict: true is set
Step 3: Run type check
Step 4: Confirm no type errors

description: Project uses monorepo structure with npm workspaces
steps: Step 1: Check package.json for workspaces config
Step 2: Verify packages directory exists
Step 3: Check multiple packages are defined
Step 4: Run npm install from root
Step 5: Confirm all packages are linked

description: Shared types package is used across packages
steps: Step 1: Locate packages/shared
Step 2: Verify types are defined
Step 3: Check web package imports shared types
Step 4: Verify CLI package imports shared types
Step 5: Confirm no type duplication

description: Analyzer package is shared between web and CLI
steps: Step 1: Locate packages/analyzer
Step 2: Verify core analysis logic is here
Step 3: Check web package depends on analyzer
Step 4: Verify CLI package depends on analyzer
Step 5: Confirm no logic duplication

description: Development setup is easy: npm install && npm run dev
steps: Step 1: Clone fresh repository
Step 2: Run npm install
Step 3: Verify installation succeeds
Step 4: Run npm run dev
Step 5: Check dev server starts
Step 6: Verify hot reload works

description: README.md provides clear setup instructions
steps: Step 1: Open README.md
Step 2: Verify prerequisites are listed
Step 3: Check installation steps are clear
Step 4: Confirm examples are provided
Step 5: Verify troubleshooting section exists

description: .env.example provides template for environment variables
steps: Step 1: Check .env.example exists
Step 2: Verify all required variables are listed
Step 3: Check descriptions/comments are helpful
Step 4: Confirm example values are safe

description: Sample repositories are provided for testing
steps: Step 1: Check examples/sample-repos directory
Step 2: Verify at least 2 sample repos exist
Step 3: Check samples cover different languages
Step 4: Confirm samples are documented

description: Logging system provides useful debugging information
steps: Step 1: Run application
Step 2: Verify logs are output to console
Step 3: Check log levels are appropriate
Step 4: Confirm errors are logged with stack traces
Step 5: Verify log format is readable

description: Hot reload works in development mode
steps: Step 1: Start dev server
Step 2: Open browser
Step 3: Edit a component file
Step 4: Save changes
Step 5: Verify browser updates without full refresh

description: Accessibility: keyboard navigation works throughout app
steps: Step 1: Open application
Step 2: Use Tab key to navigate
Step 3: Verify focus indicators are visible
Step 4: Check all interactive elements are reachable
Step 5: Confirm Enter/Space activate elements

description: Accessibility: ARIA labels present on interactive elements
steps: Step 1: Inspect interactive elements
Step 2: Verify ARIA labels exist
Step 3: Check labels are descriptive
Step 4: Confirm screen reader compatibility

description: Accessibility: Color contrast meets WCAG 2.1 AA standards
steps: Step 1: Use contrast checker tool
Step 2: Test text/background combinations
Step 3: Verify all pass 4.5:1 ratio for normal text
Step 4: Check large text passes 3:1 ratio

description: Accessibility: Images have alt text
steps: Step 1: Find all images in app
Step 2: Verify alt attributes exist
Step 3: Check alt text is descriptive
Step 4: Confirm decorative images use alt=''

description: Accessibility: Form inputs have labels
steps: Step 1: Find all form inputs
Step 2: Verify each has associated label
Step 3: Check labels are descriptive
Step 4: Confirm label/input associations are correct

description: Search functionality allows finding files by name
steps: Step 1: Open search interface
Step 2: Type file name
Step 3: Verify results appear
Step 4: Check results are relevant
Step 5: Click result to open file

description: Search functionality supports fuzzy matching
steps: Step 1: Search with partial file name
Step 2: Verify fuzzy matches are found
Step 3: Check ranking is reasonable
Step 4: Confirm typo tolerance

description: Search can filter by file type/language
steps: Step 1: Open search
Step 2: Apply file type filter
Step 3: Verify only matching types shown
Step 4: Test multiple filters

description: Search can find code by content (full-text search)
steps: Step 1: Search for code snippet
Step 2: Verify files containing snippet are found
Step 3: Check search highlights matches
Step 4: Confirm context is shown

description: User can bookmark important files for quick access
steps: Step 1: View a file
Step 2: Click bookmark button
Step 3: Verify file is bookmarked
Step 4: Navigate to bookmarks list
Step 5: Confirm bookmarked file appears
Step 6: Test removing bookmark

description: User can add notes to files and modules
steps: Step 1: Open file
Step 2: Click add note button
Step 3: Enter note text
Step 4: Save note
Step 5: Verify note appears
Step 6: Edit and delete note

description: Notes are searchable across the application
steps: Step 1: Create multiple notes
Step 2: Use search to find note by content
Step 3: Verify relevant notes are found
Step 4: Click result to view note

description: User can export learning progress report
steps: Step 1: Navigate to dashboard
Step 2: Click export report button
Step 3: Select format (PDF/Markdown)
Step 4: Verify download starts
Step 5: Open report
Step 6: Confirm progress data is included

description: Comparison mode allows comparing two codebases
steps: Step 1: Navigate to comparison feature
Step 2: Select two repositories
Step 3: Trigger comparison
Step 4: Verify differences are highlighted
Step 5: Check architectural differences shown
Step 6: Confirm technology stack comparison

description: System detects code smells and provides suggestions
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository
Step 2: Navigate to code quality section
Step 3: Verify code smells are detected
Step 4: Check suggestions are provided
Step 5: Confirm severity levels are assigned

description: Performance hotspots are identified in profiled code
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with performance data
Step 2: Navigate to performance section
Step 3: Verify hotspots are identified
Step 4: Check optimization suggestions
Step 5: Confirm impact estimates are shown

description: User can customize dashboard layout
steps: Step 1: Open dashboard
Step 2: Enter edit mode
Step 3: Drag widgets to rearrange
Step 4: Add/remove widgets
Step 5: Save layout
Step 6: Verify layout persists on reload

description: Multiple repositories can be managed simultaneously
steps: Step 1: Add first repository
Step 2: Add second repository
Step 3: Verify both appear in repository list
Step 4: Switch between repositories
Step 5: Confirm data is separate for each

description: Repository analysis can be scheduled for regular updates
steps: Step 1: Navigate to repository settings
Step 2: Configure auto-update schedule
Step 3: Save schedule
Step 4: Verify schedule is active
Step 5: Check analysis runs on schedule

description: Git branches can be analyzed separately
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with multiple branches
Step 2: Select different branch
Step 3: Trigger analysis for that branch
Step 4: Verify branch-specific data is shown
Step 5: Compare branches

description: Pull request analysis shows changes impact
steps: Step 1: Connect to PR
Step 2: Analyze PR changes
Step 3: Verify affected files are shown
Step 4: Check impact assessment is provided
Step 5: Confirm test coverage changes are highlighted

description: Code comments are extracted and searchable
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with comments
Step 2: Navigate to comments section
Step 3: Verify comments are extracted
Step 4: Search for specific comment
Step 5: Confirm results show file and line number

description: TODO comments are identified and tracked
steps: Step 1: Analyze code with TODO comments
Step 2: Navigate to TODO tracker
Step 3: Verify all TODOs are listed
Step 4: Check file locations are shown
Step 5: Confirm TODOs can be marked as done

description: API documentation is auto-generated from code
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with API endpoints
Step 2: Navigate to API documentation
Step 3: Verify endpoints are documented
Step 4: Check parameters and responses are shown
Step 5: Confirm examples are included

description: Test coverage information is displayed if available
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with coverage data
Step 2: Navigate to test coverage view
Step 3: Verify coverage percentages shown
Step 4: Check file-level coverage details
Step 5: Confirm uncovered lines are highlighted

description: Dependencies can be analyzed for security vulnerabilities
steps: Step 1: Analyze project dependencies
Step 2: Check for vulnerability scanning
Step 3: Verify vulnerabilities are reported
Step 4: Check severity levels are shown
Step 5: Confirm remediation suggestions provided

description: License information for dependencies is shown
steps: Step 1: View dependencies list
Step 2: Verify licenses are detected
Step 3: Check license types are displayed
Step 4: Confirm license compatibility is checked

description: Contribution guidelines are extracted if present
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with CONTRIBUTING.md
Step 2: Navigate to contribution info
Step 3: Verify guidelines are extracted
Step 4: Check guidelines are formatted properly

description: Responsive design works on tablet viewport
steps: Step 1: Open app in tablet viewport (768px)
Step 2: Verify layout adapts appropriately
Step 3: Check all features are accessible
Step 4: Test interactions work smoothly

description: Responsive design works on large desktop viewport
steps: Step 1: Open app in large viewport (1920px+)
Step 2: Verify layout scales well
Step 3: Check content isn't too spread out
Step 4: Confirm max-width constraints exist

description: Error boundary catches and displays React errors gracefully
steps: Step 1: Trigger component error
Step 2: Verify error boundary catches it
Step 3: Check fallback UI is shown
Step 4: Confirm error is logged
Step 5: Verify rest of app still works

description: Application handles network errors gracefully
steps: Step 1: Simulate network failure
Step 2: Trigger API request
Step 3: Verify error message is shown
Step 4: Check retry option is provided
Step 5: Test retry functionality

description: Application handles large repositories (500K+ LOC) without crashing
steps: Step 1: Prepare very large test repository
Step 2: Start analysis
Step 3: Monitor memory usage
Step 4: Verify analysis completes
Step 5: Check app remains responsive
Step 6: Confirm results are accurate

description: Session persistence: user stays logged in across browser restarts
steps: Step 1: Log in to application
Step 2: Close browser completely
Step 3: Reopen browser
Step 4: Navigate to application
Step 5: Verify user is still logged in

description: User can log out successfully
steps: Step 1: Log in
Step 2: Click logout button
Step 3: Verify user is logged out
Step 4: Check redirect to login page
Step 5: Confirm session is cleared

description: Application works offline for previously loaded data
steps: Step 1: Load repository data while online
Step 2: Disconnect from network
Step 3: Navigate within cached data
Step 4: Verify cached data is accessible
Step 5: Check appropriate message for uncached actions

description: Configuration files (package.json, tsconfig, etc) are properly documented
steps: Step 1: Check key config files exist
Step 2: Verify they include comments
Step 3: Check settings are appropriate
Step 4: Confirm all packages are necessary

description: Build process succeeds without errors
steps: Step 1: Run npm run build
Step 2: Verify build completes
Step 3: Check no errors are shown
Step 4: Confirm output directory is created
Step 5: Verify built app is functional

description: Production build is optimized (minified, tree-shaken)
steps: Step 1: Create production build
Step 2: Inspect bundle sizes
Step 3: Verify code is minified
Step 4: Check unused code is removed
Step 5: Confirm bundle size is reasonable
